title: New boss Bernard Looney will have to move BP 'beyond petroleum' for real
text:
BP has taken a risk picking Bernard Looney as its new chief executive. The former head of exploration and production may know the petroleum industry like the back of his hand, but can he adapt quickly enough to prepare the British oil major for a new world order now turning its back on fossil fuels?

Looney’s credentials as an oil man are peerless. The 49-year-old Irish farmer’s son from County Kerry joined BP as a drilling engineer in 1991 and has quickly worked his way through the ranks at its salubrious St James’s Square headquarters by proving himself on some of the company’s most important and profitable projects in the North Sea, the Gulf of Mexico and Alaska.
